explanation: The report is correct. OS_strnlen is implemented as memchr(s, 0, maxlen) and in OS_GetResourceName the maxlen argument is the caller-supplied buffer_size. There is no check that buffer_size is <= the actual allocated size of record->name_entry, so if a caller passes a buffer_size larger than the storage for name_entry memchr may read past the end of record->name_entry. That is an out-of-bounds access of the object referenced by the pointer parameter to a <string.h> function and therefore violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. (Only if there is an external, documented and enforced invariant that record->name_entry has at least buffer_size bytes would this be safe; no such guarantee is visible in the provided code.)
